experience: You and Earl R. both know Keith Teare, Chris Maresca, and 30 others

It is a strange thing, this life that many choose to live. A combination of grasping and self-delusion brings about a strange relationship - a kind of disassociation - from the truly glorious experience of being alive.
We create a vision of ourselves; a kind of avatar. It becomes the mask we put on.

My Mentoring work brings me in to contact with one of the major impacts of the information age, social media and rise of virtual reality. That impact is the the prioritization of imagining doing over actually doing.

You are busy. There is so much happening around you. People, events - the general coming and going that makes up your day. All of these keep you distracted - sociologists and psychologists would describe you as engaged and involved.

I have mentored CEOs and senior teams, guided major changes of career directions. I mentor those who have both the courage and determination to make a truly transformational journey. My approach is heavily influenced by core principles of Zen Buddhism. I provide strategic advisory in the areas of business development of business, turnaround plans, strategic planning, team development and augmentation, merger and acquisition strategies, and leadership and management style. Through my network of strategic partnerships and associations, I have brought together tailor-made teams to advise clients on a wide range of complex issues. I am supporting cancer research through the establishment of Fishing Cures, a 501(c)3 organization that sponsors annual charity fishing tournaments.

Fishing for Cures is a non-profit organization that organizes charity fishing tournaments. We support medical research through some of the front-line labs in the US. Our first tournament - Tom's Team (http://toms-team.com/) - is a unique four-day, five species tournament in Cabo san Lucas. It takes place every October - when the fishing is at it's very best.Tom’s Team is an annual charity fishing tournament in Cabo san Lucas. 100% of the net proceeds go to fund leukemia research.Our format is unique. The four-day tournament is held in the fall (when the fishing is top-notch). It is a 5-species format. (Marlin, Sailfish, Yellowfin Tuna, Dorado and Wahoo) Billfish are strictly catch-and-release. The tournament participates in a tagging program for Marlin and Sailfish.Boats are sponsored by either a company or an individual. Teams are one to four anglers. There are lots of ways to earn points and many awards – some you may not want and some you definitely want! We run a pledge campaign – every team signs up backers – every boat is a winner for charity.Read the back story of how the tournament came to be. Then take a look at the tournament. If you love to fish and want to head to Cabo for a good cause, sign up as a sponsor! We guarantee that you will have memories that will last a lifetime and the feeling that you have done something very good for people suffering from a terrible disease.

As Senior Vice President for Strategic Initiatives of the Varley Group, I am responsible for identifying, negotiating and closing acquisitions in the US market. I lead a team which is dedicated to forming strategic partnerships which either leverage or complement the substantial business base of the Varley Group.

Truly he would be my "Chief" anytime and will never ever regret to get his guidance career wise, anytime.Thanks a lot Chief.
